metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5462 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw in DRBG number generation within the Network Security Services (NSS) library where the internal state V does not correctly carry bits over. The NSS library has been updated to fix this issue to address this issue and Firefox ESR 52.1 has been updated with NSS version 3.28.4. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.1, Firefox ESR < 45.9, Firefox ESR < 52.1, and Firefox < 53.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
